page.title: 09HARLINGTON OVERVIEW
page.content: {Housing}includes examples from 17th, 18th, 19th, and 20th centuries. Five buildings are on the Statutory List of Buildings of Architectural Historical Interest. Several now have a different use. Many roads are named after famous or local people, e.g. Bunyan, Monmouth, Lincoln, Windgate and Astrey The 400 year old{Manor}is being restored and may be used as a beauty clinic with swimming pool. Most new housing is around Park Leys, Goswell End and Barton Road. 132 of the total 900 houses are council owned. The{ {trade}is comprised of a newsagent, supermarket, greengrocer, countryfare, off license, potter and an estate agents. The pottery is in the stables of an 1870 ale house. Products are made and fired on the premises. The { {population }of 2480 already exeeds the prediction of 2390 for 1980.
